title: Portrait of a Man
provenance_text:
Franz Friedrich (Fritz) Grunbaum collection, Vienna, before WWII;  Mathilde Lukacs (Grunbaum's sister-in-law), Vienna and Brussels*; Gutekunst & Klipstein, Eberhard Kornfeld, gallery partner, Bern (now Galerie Kornfeld), 1956*; Galerie St. Etienne, New York, NY, 1956; gift of Otto Kalir (owner of Galerie St. Étienne) to Museum, February 1960.

Note: 
*See information in curatorial file on extensive litigation regarding another Schiele drawing, which also involves a Gutekunst & Klipstein and Galerie St. Étienne provenance.  It includes claims/counter claims of legal ownership of the Grunbaum collection during/after WWII and the role of various parties, including Mathilde Lukacs and the aforementioned galleries, in its eventual disposition. 

Updated by CGK
December 2012
